Riemann Sums
The theory of limits of finite approximations was made precise by the German mathematician Bernhard Riemann. We introduce the notion of a Riemann sum, which underlies the theory of the definite integral.
Let a closed interval [a, b] be partitioned by points a < x < x < < x < b 1 2 n− 1 To make the notation consistent, so that

Theorem – Integrability of Continuous Functions
If a function f is continuous over the interval [a, b], or if f has at most finitely many jump discontinuities
there, then the definite integral ∫ a b f ( ) x dx exists and f in integrable over [a, b]
